text.0: let us with tuneful skill proclaim these generations of the gods.
text.1: that one may see them when these hymns are chanted in a future age.
text.2: these brahmaṇaspati produced with blast and smelting like a smith.
text.3: existence in an earlier age of gods from nonexistence sprang.
text.4: existence in the earliest age of gods from nonexistence sprang.
text.5: thereafter were the regions born this sprang from the productive power.
text.6: earth sprang from the productive power the regions from the earth were born.
text.7: dakṣa was born of aditi and aditi was dakṣas child.
text.8: for aditi o dakṣa she who is thy daughter was brought forth.
text.9: after her were the blessed gods born sharers of immortal life.
text.10: when ye o gods in yonder deep closeclasping one another stood.
text.11: thence as of dancers from your feet a thickening cloud of dust arose.
text.12: when o ye gods like yatis ye caused all existing things to grow.
text.13: then ye brought sūrya forward who was lying hidden in the sea.
text.14: eight are the sons of adid who from her body sprang to life.
text.15: with seven she went to meet the gods she cast martanda far away.
text.16: so with her seven sons aditi went forth to meet the earlier age.
text.17: she brought martanda thitherward to spring to life and die again.
